definition[0]: able to learn and understand things quickly
example[1]: Lucy is quite clever and does well at school.
definition[1]: able to use your intelligence to get what you want, especially in a slightly dishonest way
definition[2]: skilful at doing a particular thing
example[3]: Bill’s very clever with his hands.
example[5]: He was clever at finding bargains.
definition[3]: done or made in an unusual or interesting way that is very effective
definition[4]: used jokingly when someone has done something silly or stupid
example[8]: ‘When I got to the library I found I’d left the books at home.’ ‘That was clever!’
